item.title: Manga Reader Updates
item.description:
We've been really busy this week! We have both new features and series for you. The new feature is the series manga info page. Now when you click on the series name on the manga page, it takes you to a page with info about the series, including a short summary, which should help you decide if it's a manga that would interest you. From there, you select what chapter you want to view from the pull down menu. In addition, the name of the mangaka and its genre are linked to a search page that brings up other series that are by that author or in the same genre, which can help you find other series that you might be interested in. But if you are caught up on the manga and don't want to have to go through that page every time, you can always just click on the latest chapter number on the manga page and that will take you straight to that chapter.

Because this offers essentially the same thing as the More Info page and more, we decided to give that page the axe. Unless a lot of people get really up to arms about us removing the page, it's going to stay gone. We have also gone through the reader code and optimized parts of it, so you might notice that your browsing experience is slightly faster now.

Another feature that is actually kind of old, but we never announced is we are flagging series that might be inappropriate for readers that are younger or sensitive. Usually these series contain either lots of blood and gore, nudity (we do not host any hentai manga though), or have more mature themes such as suicide. If you find a series that has been flagged with this notice, you can generally tell which of these it will contain by looking at its genre list. For example, a flagged "ecchi" manga will probably have nudity, a flagged "mature" chapter will probably have more adult themes such as morals and suicide, etc. If you find a series that you feel should be tagged, but isn't, email us and let us know.

And now for the new series, we added a bunch this week, including some of the big shounen titles like D.Gray-man, One Piece, Mahou Sensei Negima, and Air Gear. Here is the full list. To get more information on a series, just click its name and you'll be taken to its info page.
[spoiler]
  • Ai Kora

  • Air Gear

  • Cat Street

  • Change 123

  • D.Gray-man

  • Elfen Lied

  • Eyeshield 21

  • Mahou Sensei Negima!

  • Nana

  • No Bra

  • One Piece

  • Parallel

  • Pastel

  • Sekirei

  • Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann

  • Tenjou Tenge

  • Toradora!
[/spoiler]
As for new chapters, we added a bunch as well: Ouran chapter 64, Fairy Tail 102, Rosario+Vampire Season II chapter 11, Alive 34, To-LOVE-Ru 114, Naruto 416 and Bakuman 4.

Edit: Those of you who were experiencing issued trying to download the Bleach manga, this issue has now been fixed. Sorry for the inconvenience.
item.author: admin@bleach7.com (anpan)

item.title: Bleach Episode 187 SUB | Important Anime Announcement
item.description:
Anew week is upon us, and so is a new episode of Bleach. This episode is entitled [spoiler]Ichigo Rages! The Assassin's Secret.[/spoiler] Download links can be found below and will be linkied as they are released.

RAW
[Horrible-Raws] Bleach Episode 187
[TV-Japan] Bleach Episode 187
[l33t-raws] Bleach Episode 187
----------------------------------------
SUB
[Dattebayo] Bleach Episode 187
[Flomp-Rumbel] Bleach Episode 187

Direct download of the sub by Dattebayo is now available!
Anime Direct Download Page

You can view the raw right now through your browser in our online streamer!
Anime RAW Online Streaming Page


Episode 187 Screenshots



I have some important news regarding the Bleach anime so make sure you read this carefully! After Bleach 188 airs next week, there will be no Bleach anime for two weeks in a row. After this break, Bleach will be moving to a new timeslot and will begin airing on Tuesdays at 6:00 PM JST. This means that Bleach 189 will be airing on October 7th. This is expected to coincide with the beginning of a new arc in the anime. If you are interested in what is taking Bleach's timeslot, it is an anime called "Stitch" which is a spin-off of the Disney movie Lilo and Stitch.

Thank you to all of you who have given donations to Bleach7! We really appreciate your support for Bleach7. We have already accumulated over $100 in bandwidth charges in addition to our monthly server fees, so any donation amount is still appreciated.
item.author: admin@bleach7.com (anpan)

item.title: Bleach: The DiamondDust Rebellion SUB
item.description:
What's this? I don't know, certainly nothing nobody would be interested in I'm sure. So move along, nothing to see here folks. Oh... Your still here... Well since your here, you may aswell grab the new Bleach movie.


[DB] Bleach: The DiamondDust Rebellion Torrent (recommended)

Direct Download


DiamondDust Rebellion Screenshots


In addition, we have the theme song single album and the movie OST available for download.

DiamonDust Rebellion Music Page

Our updated movie guide contains information on this movie, as well as the newly announced third movie, Bleach Fade to Black, Kimi no Na o Yobu, including a short trailer for it.

Bleach Movie Guide

And before you ask, no we don't know when Fade to Black will be subbed.

If you're wondering why the donation goal is so high this month, it is because of the movie. We used over 10 TB of bandwidth in one week for the movie last year, and we expect it will be even higher this year. That being said, we usually only move 10 TB of bandwidth in a month, which means we are going to have some pretty hefty bandwidth charges at the end of the month, so we would really appreciate it if you could spare any amount of donations.
item.author: exiledviper@gmail.com (ExiledVip3r)

item.title: Upcoming Downtime
item.description:
** Note:

The time was originally going to be last night, however in my own stupidity I misplaced my laptop cable and it went black when I was getting ready to get started. My desktop isn't as dependable and I wasn't able to retain a connection long enough.

As such, the move will actually occur today (Monday) night, Tuesday night at the latest.

The objective is to not actually experience downtime on the site, but instead to put it into readonly, and then move it over. When your DNS updates, you will be able to comment and so on again. No downloads or other material will be affected. You will still be able to read and browse, just not modify/comment.

Thanks... and sorry for the delay.

**

Hi There! This is my first communication on here and not many may know me. I've been keeping bleach7 running for the last few months since that massive period of downtime we experienced not too long ago.

The bleach7 and bleachforums site are a little bit of a complicated endeavor, in that they are hosted on a web server with many many file mirrors that serve all the great episodes that everyone loves and holds dear.

Up until recently, we've been able to keep them both on relatively small hardware (while the files were occupying the greater bulk of the hardware needed), but now we have started to grow heavily and are therefore needing a change.

As such, we are going to be migrating to a new infrastructure this weekend to increase the stability of the service. While before bleach7 and bleachforums were hosted on one of the mirrors, we are now isolating them to their own place.

The order has been put in, moving will begin most likely tomorrow evening. My objective is to flip over to the new server very late Saturday (close to Midnight/1:00AM Sunday CST). This is usually the slowest traffic period. The total amount of downtime will be in how long the DNS takes to move over, as well as how long it takes to transfer over the final database backup. Before doing this we will test it and give a final announcement prior to.

If you have any questions regarding the change, post a comment and I'll be happy to answer :)

After the move I suppose I'll give myself a more formal introduction :P

item.title: Weekly Manga Reader Updates
item.description: No new features this week, but we did add a few more series to the reader including Ayu Mayu, Akagami no Shirayukihime, Boku ni Natta Watashi, and Gekka no Kimi. As for chapter updates, we've got Naruto 415, Fairy Tail 101, and To-LOVE-Ru 88 (uncensored, mind your eyes please). If you were a fan of Death Note, we also have Bakuman chapter 3 which is by the same author and illustrator that brought you Death Note. For other recently added manga, you can check our latest manga page.
item.author: admin@bleach7.com (anpan)
